body:
Dear Game Of Thrones fans

Pls help me. Me and my mum are arguing over this.

(Now quick disclaimer I haven’t watched it yet - waiting to binge because cliffhangers are a bitch)

So there are an army of guys without their dicks and I was like

  • “So how do they pee?”
  • Well, there’d be a hole Maya
  • “Oh okay….. do they squat then?”
  • No they’d still aim.
  • “But how ma? There’s nothing to do any aiming with?”
  • Well they’re badass soldiers, they can do it.
  • “Okay? Seriously wouldn’t they squat?”
  • No because they wouldn’t want to be known for not having a Willy
  • “But there’s a w(hole) army! It’s not one guy. Forget social norms, they won’t care.”
  • Maya, come on. They’re strong masculine men, they’re not not caring.
  • “Didn’t understand that bit but I guess?”
  • ~ Five minutes later ~
  • “Itd run down their leg.”

And that was the argument -my mum thinks that they’d want to look tough and normal so they’d aim ‘there’s not plumbing back then’. But they’d be squatting to poo so I say they’d just kinda do that???

I don’t know. Please someone, ANYONE, add to this

(p.s. my step dad was no help - he didn’t like the question)

I’ve come to realize a pattern whenever I create a username for games that I play:

“How the fuck can I incorporate Sansa’s name in this?”

sansastark, sansastoneheart, sapphicsansa


With the exceptions of:

ladystoneheart & AryaStoneheart

body: ☝️Truly, one of the best Game of Thrones Sansa I book analysis to date. These guys know how to avoid POV traps that even seasoned readers often miss. The video is also a continuation although “stark contrast” companion piece from her sister Aryas POV. I can’t wait for more. ❤️

tags: in this chapter we meet matt dumba
summary:
Chapter 14 | The Artist Formerly Known as Prince
        |
        Minnesota, State Of...
title:
Chapter 14 | The Artist Formerly Known as Prince
        |
        Minnesota, State Of...
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
When he pulled up to his apartment, her nerves were starting to set in. She twiddled her thumbs, fiddling with her purse and the loose threads on her jersey, kicking her heels together. Sandor simply held out his hand, forever calming her, and she took it. He kept her close on the walk up to his door, and when they entered, he immediately went to get them both a glass of wine. Sansa went to the window, looking out over the skyline. She hoped that the snow would stick through the night and that they’d wake up to the city blanketed in white.

“Here, little bird,” he kissed the top of her head as he passed her the wine, and she took it with a murmur of thanks. He watched the cityscape with her for a moment, taking a sip.

“Tonight was wonderful,” Sansa said quietly, and Sandor lowered the wine glass slowly, deliberately.

“I’m glad you enjoyed it,” he stated, before his eyes slid to her and he added the next words like he knew exactly what was on her mind, “and it can be perfectly lovely just like this. I don’t want you doing anything you’re not ready for, Sansa.”

“No, that’s the thing,” she set her wine glass down so that she could take one of his large hands in her smaller ones. “I am ready. I want this, I want you. Just…. As long as we go slow….”

“You tell me when to stop,” Sandor ordered, searching her face and Sansa nodded, before he carefully lowered his head down to kiss her.

summary: I didn't know that liking Arya involved hating on Sansa and apparently I'm supposed to like Dany.  I didn't think it was an...
question: I didn't know that liking Arya involved hating on Sansa and apparently I'm supposed to like Dany.  I didn't think it was an either/or proposition with the Stark sisters since I love them both (and I don't like Dany).  And apparently Cat is mean to Arya.  (I love Cat).  I thought Arya loves and admires both her mother and sister and wants a closer relationship with both of them.  I guess I didn't get the memo.
answer: Fandoms try to dictate people’s tastes and no fandom does it better than the ASOIAF fandom where there’s a strict hierarchy. Characters like Sansa, Catelyn and Cersei are near the bottom for various reasons. You can only like them if you agree they are the worst and should spend the rest of their lives serving characters at the top of that hierarchy (Arya, Jon, Jaime/Brienne/Tyrion, respectively). There isn’t a memo here, it’s more like a shitty fandom law and I hate it because there are Tywin stans (Tywin!) here, some people think Ramsay is hot, a few people like to write Euron/OC fics. They don’t get as much shit as folks like us do so if you can find it in yourself to like Arya, Sansa and Cat at the same time (gasp), do it. Fuck up the fandom hierarchy.

They don’t get as much shit as folks like us do so if you can find it in yourself to like Arya, Sansa and Cat at the same time (gasp), do it. Fuck up the fandom hierarchy.

summary: I think the big thing about the Sansan/Sanrion ships is the whole Beauty and the Beast motif.  I thought the point of Beauty and...
question: I think the big thing about the Sansan/Sanrion ships is the whole Beauty and the Beast motif.  I thought the point of Beauty and the Beast was that the Beast was a gentleman who just happened to look ugly on the outside but neither one of them respected Sansa's agency.  I do think she will see them again, deal with her abuse and trauma, get some closure and then be able to move on with somebody brave, gentle and strong.
answer: They really misunderstand it. It’s not ugly man + beautiful woman alone. It’s kindred spirits meeting and growing together. Sansans and Sanrions think that deep down, past their traumas, these two men are two good people despite all the evidence going against that. They are both paedophiles, they both nearly raped Sansa and they have both killed innocent people. They have too much to work on in terms of their moral development before they can reach the point where they are Sansa’s Beast. Not to mention, Sansa isn’t looking for a Beast, she wants to go home. That’s what her story has been about- going back home and becoming someone her parents would be proud of.

That’s what her story has been about- going back home and becoming someone her parents would be proud of.

blog.name: turtle-paced
blog.title: turtle-paced
blog.description: Writing at the speed of the race course paradox.

summary: @cynicalclassicist asked: Concerning the recent ask saying Tyrion predicted Cersei better then LF I should probably say LF is...
body:
@cynicalclassicist asked: Concerning the recent ask saying Tyrion predicted Cersei better then LF I should probably say LF is not the genius he tries to portray himself as. Are there any particular instances where he massively misreads a situation?

The lie about the dagger is the biggest example I can think of, where it’s pretty much luck that things don’t unravel around his ears - not just with Varys, but later with Tyrion. He’s also made plenty of jokes that fell a bit flat. Littlefinger is also in the process of misreading a situation. Sooner or later, he’s going to trust in his ability to control Sansa, which I think is all but certain to backfire on him quite dramatically.

Also what do you think of the LF helped Robert’s Rebellion theories? I’ve heard people say he gave Brandon false info or the theory he was being treated in the Maesters’ quarters at Riverrun when a letter arrive for Brandon explaining what had happened and LF destroyed it. I think it’s fans again trying to make LF a bigger character then he really is.

Yeah…another theory I don’t see the necessity of. Complicates timelines, doesn’t clear up any outstanding mysteries. Overall, I think Littlefinger’s “from nobody to nightmare” narrative works best if he really did start out that helpless nobody.

@cynicalclassicist asked: Concerning the recent ask saying Tyrion predicted Cersei better then LF I should probably say LF is not the genius he tries to portray himself as. Are there any particular instances where he massively misreads a situation?

The lie about the dagger is the biggest example I can think of, where it’s pretty much luck that things don’t unravel around his ears - not just with Varys, but later with Tyrion. He’s also made plenty of jokes that fell a bit flat. Littlefinger is also in the process of misreading a situation. Sooner or later, he’s going to trust in his ability to control Sansa, which I think is all but certain to backfire on him quite dramatically.

Also what do you think of the LF helped Robert’s Rebellion theories? I’ve heard people say he gave Brandon false info or the theory he was being treated in the Maesters’ quarters at Riverrun when a letter arrive for Brandon explaining what had happened and LF destroyed it. I think it’s fans again trying to make LF a bigger character then he really is.

Yeah…another theory I don’t see the necessity of. Complicates timelines, doesn’t clear up any outstanding mysteries. Overall, I think Littlefinger’s “from nobody to nightmare” narrative works best if he really did start out that helpless nobody.

blog.name: cappymightwrite
blog.title: I'm standing on the edge of some crazy cliff
blog.description: Decided to convert this old sideblog into a place to post some fanfic stuff, plus general things that give me writing vibes...Find me on AO3 as undercovercaptain x

tags: because I love Joseph Mawle and I need more fic of him
summary: This strong old blizzard I will let it blow to undiscovered places underneath the snow  (On Powdered Snow – Agnes Obel) He felt...
caption:
This strong old blizzard
I will let it blow
to undiscovered places
underneath the snow

(On Powdered Snow – Agnes Obel)

He felt sure that the cold would get him before anything else; it was as though winter had set up home in his very marrow. Hunkered down and huddled up against tree roots, he would try to remember what it was like to be warm: to feel sweat running down his back as he sparred with Ned and Brandon in the training yard as their father watched on; the prickle of steam on his face as he ran past hot-pools in the Godswood with Lya racing up ahead; the warmth of his mother’s chambers as she held him close and sung him a lullaby from the age of the First Men. Days long past. When life was simple, pure and innocent. The life of children with no thought for lovers, marriages or vows. Childhood days with childish cares, long gone, long past, never to return.

An extract from the first chapter of Speak of The Wolf, my new Bensa fic for framboise :) An AU in which Benjen manages to make it back to the Wall and becomes tangled up in the issue of the Winterfell Lordship initiated by King Stannis. When Sansa escapes the Vale and Littlefinger’s clutches this complicates things further…

underneath the snow

summary: What do you think of Theon/Sansa?
question: What do you think of Theon/Sansa?
answer: I think they have a great relationship that could grow stronger as time goes on. Romantically, I find them incompatible. They each have so much trauma to work through and their story arc will lead them down different paths. I doesn’t help that book Theon doesn’t care about book Sansa except that he saw her a way to become part of the family through marriage.

reblog.comment: I think they have a great relationship that could grow stronger as time goes on. Romantically, I find them incompatible. They each have so much trauma to work through and their story arc will lead them down different paths. I doesn’t help that book Theon doesn’t care about book Sansa except that he saw her a way to become part of the family through marriage.

They each have so much trauma to work through and their story arc will lead them down different paths. I doesn’t help that book Theon doesn’t care about book Sansa except that he saw her a way to become part of the family through marriage.

They each have so much trauma to work through and their story arc will lead them down different paths. I doesn’t help that book Theon doesn’t care about book Sansa except that he saw her a way to become part of the family through marriage.

blog.name: mimi0108
blog.title: Mimi0108
blog.description: I feed on cinema, tv shows, books, animals, history, music, travel, photography and especially laughter.

summary: Sansa & Arya were smarter than Littlefinger.
title: Sansa & Arya were smarter than Littlefinger.
body:
Many people rely on the deleted scene with Bran to devalue Sansa. It should be remembered that this scene has been deleted so is not to be taken into account.

Moreover, it was never said that Sansa knew nothing when she went to see Bran. On the contrary, it’s because Sansa understands that she’s going to see her brother to ask him to fill in the blanks.

That’s how I saw it:

The Starks sisters have fallen into the trap of Littlefinger (who has years of experience). Arya attacked and threatened her sister who, feeling cornered, began to fear her younger sister. However, when she confronts Sansa in her bedroom, Arya begins to understand that something is wrong. Sansa seems just terrified and not “terrorized because she has something to hide”. Knowing from whom she got the letter, Arya gives Littlefinger’s dagger to Sansa and leaves, leaving the cards in her hands. She testing her one last time to see if her sister is innocent as she starts to suspect it or not.

Sansa understands that something is wrong and is more cautious with Littlefinger when she receives Jon’s letter announcing that he has bent the knee to Daenerys. Sansa has never devalued and criticized her brother in front of Littlefinger and now she allows herself to do so ? She saying that Jon “never took into account” her opinion what we know is false since he named her regent. Here, she’s waiting to see what Littlefinger is going to say. And he falls into the trap by suggesting to dismiss the king. Sansa then has a moment of silence as she looks at Littlefinger with a weird look and saying, “Even if I wanted, Arya would never let me…”. Sansa throws the bait and Littlefinger grabs it.


Obviously, Sansa still has to learn, she still has demons. She is indeed jealous to see Arya and Brienne so close. She doesn’t want to share her bodyguard. She’s jealous that Bran gives the dagger to Arya and not to her. But is it really a serious crime? Arya speaks of beheading the lords, considering attacking her sister etc… Nobody is perfect. And being jealous of losing someone’s attention is really a minor weakness considering her rough past. Especially since it does not really matter. It’s just a feeling, not an act. These are just the anxieties of a girl who are quite alone while all she was looking for was the love and affection of the people around her.
